name: Blocked threadpools
description: This rule checks whether there are stages with the blocked threads.

fields.name: content
fields.value:
1. Check for any suspicious activities or errors in the system log.
 2. Analyze the workload and resource usage on the node. Identify if there is an unusually high load or resource contention.
 3. Review the nodetool status command output to identify if there are any nodes with high latency or excessive pending tasks.
 4. If high latency or pending tasks are identified, consider increasing the number of tokens allocated to the node or adding more replicas to distribute the workload more evenly.
 5. Monitor the node's disk space and ensure that it has sufficient space to handle the current workload.
 6. Check for any misconfigurations or inconsistencies in the Cassandra configuration files.
 7. Perform a full cluster restart to flush out any transient issues.
 8. If the problem persists, consider checking for any third-party tools or plugins that could be interfering with the threadpool.
 9. Update the Cassandra version to the latest stable release, as compatibility issues may have been resolved in newer versions.
 10. Consult the official Cassandra documentation or seek assistance from the community forums for further guidance.

By following these steps, you should be able to diagnose and address the Blocked threadpools issue in your Cassandra node.
